wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the MenuPRO-App-main project. Explain its purpose as a full-stack digital menu and ordering system for restaurants, enabling customer ordering via QR codes and restaurant management through a dedicated dashboard. Describe the dual-user experience (customer and restaurant), core features such as menu parsing (PDF/OCR), order management, authentication (email/OTP), and QR code generation. Document the high-level architecture using Next.js App Router, React components, and API routes. Include deployment targets, scalability considerations, and integration points like email services and JWT. Provide a conceptual diagram of the system flow between customer, restaurant, and backend services. Make this accessible to new developers and stakeholders while offering technical depth for implementation context.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the authentication system in MenuPRO-App-main. Detail the dual-flow design for customer and restaurant authentication using email verification and OTP validation. Explain the implementation of JWT token generation, signing, and expiration policies. Document the request/response flow for send-verification and verify-otp endpoints, including payload structure and error responses. Describe integration with Gmail SMTP for email delivery and token storage mechanisms. Include sequence diagrams showing token lifecycle and user verification steps. Address security considerations such as OTP rate limiting, token invalidation, input sanitization, and protection against brute-force attacks. Provide code examples from route handlers and middleware usage.

wiki_catalogs.name: PWA Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the PWA frontend architecture in MenuPRO-App-main. Detail how PWAApp serves as the container component managing global state (user session, cart, current screen) and orchestrates navigation between customer-facing screens. Explain the unidirectional data flow from PWAApp to presentational components like menu-screen.tsx and cart-screen.tsx via props. Document the use of React hooks (useState, useEffect) for managing authentication state, cart items, and screen transitions. Describe the integration with authentication APIs (send-verification, verify-otp) and order creation. Include diagrams illustrating component hierarchy, state propagation, and event handling lifecycle. Address responsive design for mobile-first PWA experience, accessibility compliance using Radix UI primitives, and performance optimizations such as conditional rendering and memoization of cart calculations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Onboarding Screen
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the onboarding-screen component used in the customer ordering flow. Explain its purpose as the initial entry point for users, capturing restaurant context or guiding first-time access. Document the UI layout, button interactions, and navigation triggers that direct users to the QR scanning step. Include code examples showing how state is initialized and how routing is handled via Next.js navigation. Describe integration with the PWAApp container and how it sets up the flow context. Address common issues such as incorrect restaurant selection or navigation failures, and provide troubleshooting tips. Include performance considerations for fast load times on mobile networks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Restaurant Onboarding
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the restaurant onboarding process, focusing on the initial registration and business information collection. Explain how the restaurant-onboarding-screen captures essential details such as restaurant name, email, address, and contact information. Document form validation logic, error handling, and the transition to email verification via the /api/restaurant/send-verification API. Include integration with state management in RestaurantApp, data persistence, and user experience considerations. Provide examples of valid input formats, common validation errors, and recovery paths. Address accessibility features and responsive design implementation for various device sizes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Authentication Service responsible for secure user and restaurant onboarding via email verification and OTP validation. Explain the JWT-based token flow, request validation, and temporary token storage using in-memory structures. Document the implementation of rate limiting, token expiration (5-minute TTL), and error handling for invalid or expired codes. Include code examples from route handlers showing middleware usage and response structures. Describe how both customer and restaurant authentication flows reuse the same service with role-specific contexts. Address common issues such as email delivery failures, OTP retry limits, and security best practices for production deployment.

wiki_catalogs.name: MenuItem Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the MenuItem entity used across both customer and restaurant interfaces in MenuPRO-App-main. Define all fields including id, name, description, price, image, category (with allowed enum values: appetizers, mains, desserts, beverages), and optional customization options (size, customizations). Document differences between client-side and server-side representations, particularly the isAvailable flag in restaurant context and image fallback behavior. Explain validation rules such as non-negative pricing and required fields. Include TypeScript interface definitions from both pwa-app.tsx and restaurant-app.tsx, highlighting structural similarities and usage context differences. Provide sample payloads for menu display, upload, and API transmission. Detail how MenuItem instances are shared between CartItem and OrderItem contexts, and describe serialization patterns during order creation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the authentication endpoints in MenuPRO-App-main. Document POST /api/auth/send-verification and POST /api/auth/verify-otp for customer authentication, and POST /api/restaurant/send-verification and POST /api/restaurant/verify-otp for restaurant authentication. For each endpoint, specify HTTP method, URL, request headers (Content-Type, Authorization if applicable), request body schema (email, OTP), and response format (success, error messages). Include JWT token generation on successful OTP verification, status codes (200, 400, 401, 429), and example cURL commands. Explain the OTP expiration policy (5 minutes), rate limiting (3 attempts per email), and security practices (token storage, XSS protection). Provide client-side implementation guidance for handling verification flows and error states.

wiki_catalogs.name: Button Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the Button component in MenuPRO-App-main. Explain its purpose as a reusable, accessible, and styled button primitive built on Radix UI and enhanced with Tailwind CSS. Document all props including variant (primary, secondary, destructive), size (sm, md, lg), loading state, icon support, and disabled behavior. Include TypeScript interface definitions, default props, and event handling (onClick, etc.). Provide practical usage examples from the codebase such as in OTP verification and order confirmation screens. Explain integration with forms and navigation, accessibility attributes (role, aria-*), and responsive styling. Address performance considerations like preventing re-renders with React.memo and minimizing bundle size. Include code snippets demonstrating customization via className and compound components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Onboarding Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the PWA onboarding flow in MenuPRO-App-main. Explain the implementation of OnboardingScreen as the initial entry point for customers, its visual design using Tailwind CSS gradients and responsive layout, and its interaction with the PWAApp container via the onComplete callback. Document how the onboarding screen guides users toward QR scanning, sets the initial context for the ordering journey, and handles navigation transitions. Include code examples showing the event propagation from button click to state update in PWAApp. Address accessibility considerations such as ARIA labels and keyboard navigation, and performance aspects like lazy loading of onboarding assets. Discuss integration with the overall customer journey and potential customization points for branding.

wiki_catalogs.name: Restaurant Onboarding Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the restaurant onboarding flow in MenuPRO-App-main. Explain how the RestaurantOnboardingScreen collects initial restaurant information and triggers email verification via the /api/restaurant/send-verification API. Document the state transition from 'onboarding' to 'otp-verification' upon successful email validation using handleEmailVerified. Include the form structure, input validation logic, error handling for invalid domains or duplicate entries, and integration with localStorage for session persistence. Provide code examples showing how user input is captured and passed to the parent RestaurantApp container. Address UX considerations such as responsive layout for desktop/tablet, accessibility attributes from Radix UI components, and graceful degradation when API calls fail.

wiki_catalogs.name: Generate QR Code API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for POST /api/restaurant/generate-qr. Detail the HTTP POST method, endpoint URL, and required request headers including Authorization with JWT token. Document the request body schema containing tableNumber (string) and optional parameters like restaurantId. Specify the response format: a 200 OK with a JSON containing a data URL or base64-encoded PNG image of the QR code linking to the digital menu for that table. Include error responses: 400 for invalid input, 401 for unauthorized access, and 500 for server errors. Provide example cURL command for testing. Explain integration with the restaurant dashboard and usage in generating printable QRs for physical tables. Highlight security via JWT validation and rate limiting considerations. Include performance tips for caching QR images and optimizing image size for fast loading on mobile devices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Customer Send Verification
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the POST /api/auth/send-verification endpoint used in customer authentication. Detail the HTTP POST method, request headers (Content-Type: application/json), and request body schema containing 'email' field. Document the server-side logic for generating a 6-digit OTP, storing it with a 5-minute expiration in memory or cache, and sending it via Gmail SMTP as implemented in the route handler. Specify response formats: 200 on success with message, 400 for invalid email, 429 if rate-limited (max 3 attempts per email within 15 minutes). Include security considerations such as email validation, rate limiting to prevent abuse, and secure transmission over HTTPS. Provide example cURL command and JavaScript fetch code for client integration. Explain how this endpoint integrates with the customer onboarding flow in onboarding-screen.tsx and email-verification-screen.tsx.

wiki_catalogs.name: Email Verification
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the email verification process in the PWA frontend. Explain how EmailVerificationScreen captures user email input, performs client-side validation using a regex pattern, and triggers the API call to /api/auth/send-verification. Document the state management of email, loading, error, and success states within the component, and how the userEmail is passed from PWAApp via the handleEmailVerified callback. Include code examples showing form submission handling, localStorage usage for storing pending email (via 'pendingEmail'), and UI transitions upon successful submission. Address security considerations such as input sanitization, protection against XSS via proper escaping in JSX, and the temporary nature of verification codes. Discuss UX elements like the resend timer, disabled states during loading, and privacy messaging displayed to users.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the technology stack of MenuPRO-App-main. Detail the use of Next.js 14 with App Router for server-side rendering and API routes, React for component-based UI, TypeScript for type safety, and Tailwind CSS for utility-first styling. Explain the role of Radix UI for accessible, unstyled components and their integration with the design system. Cover backend dependencies including jsonwebtoken for authentication, pdf-parse for document extraction, Tesseract.js for OCR-based menu parsing, and qrcode for QR generation. Include configuration details from next.config.js, tsconfig.json, and tailwind.config.ts. Provide version compatibility notes, rationale for framework choices, and performance implications. Include code snippets showing integration patterns and best practices for extending the stack.

wiki_catalogs.name: Order Management System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed architectural documentation for the order management backend in MenuPRO-App-main. Focus on the /api/orders/create endpoint implementation using Next.js route handlers. Explain the request validation process, JSON payload structure, and order persistence mechanism. Document the data flow from API invocation to order creation, including cart data transformation and response formatting. Describe error handling strategies for invalid carts, payment failures, and server errors. Include integration points with frontend PWAApp state and potential database interactions. Provide examples of successful and failed request scenarios. Address scalability considerations, logging practices, and potential extension points for order retrieval and status updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Restaurant Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the restaurant frontend architecture in MenuPRO-App-main. Explain how RestaurantApp acts as the central container managing state for restaurant onboarding, authentication, menu upload, and dashboard navigation. Detail the state management pattern using React hooks to handle form data, verification status, and uploaded menu content. Document the navigation flow between onboarding, OTP verification, menu upload, and dashboard screens. Describe integration with backend services like parse-menu and generate-qr APIs. Illustrate component hierarchy and data flow with diagrams showing how user input in menu-upload-screen.tsx is processed and submitted. Address responsive layout considerations for tablet/desktop use, accessibility implementation via Radix UI, and error handling during form submission and file parsing.

wiki_catalogs.name: QR Scan Screen
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the qr-scan-screen component that enables table identification via QR code scanning. Explain its role in linking the customer to a specific restaurant and table context. Document the integration with the browser's camera using HTML5 media APIs, real-time scanning logic, and error handling for unsupported devices. Include code examples showing how scanned data is parsed and validated before navigation to the menu screen. Describe fallback mechanisms like manual entry and how scan results propagate through the PWAApp state. Address edge cases such as malformed QR codes or expired sessions. Provide UX guidelines for camera permissions and accessibility considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: OTP Verification
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the OTP verification step in the restaurant management flow. Explain how the restaurant-otp-screen handles one-time password delivery and validation using the /api/restaurant/verify-otp endpoint. Document the email-to-OTP transition, input validation, countdown timers for resend functionality, and error states for invalid codes. Describe integration with the RestaurantApp state machine, token storage in localStorage, and navigation to the next onboarding stage. Include security considerations around OTP expiration, rate limiting, and session integrity. Provide troubleshooting guidance for delivery failures and best practices for user communication during verification.

wiki_catalogs.name: Order Management Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Order Management Service that handles creation, validation, and persistence of customer orders. Detail the request schema including cart items, restaurant ID, and customer metadata. Explain server-side validation logic, error responses for invalid payloads, and success response structure with order confirmation data. Document integration with the PWA frontend, including state synchronization between cart and order submission. Include practical examples of API usage from cart-screen.tsx and how order confirmation is handled post-submission. Address idempotency considerations, data retention, and potential extension points for payment integration.

wiki_catalogs.name: CartItem Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the CartItem model, which extends MenuItem with shopping cart-specific properties in the customer ordering flow. Document the quantity field and optional selectedOptions (size, customizations) that capture user choices during ordering. Explain how CartItem inherits all MenuItem properties while adding state specific to the shopping session. Include the TypeScript interface definition showing extension via 'extends MenuItem'. Describe how CartItem arrays are managed in PWAApp state, including addition, quantity updates, and removal operations. Provide examples of CartItem instantiation from menu selection and transformation into OrderItem during checkout. Address client-side validation rules and synchronization with local storage for session persistence.

wiki_catalogs.name: Orders API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Orders API in MenuPRO-App-main. Document POST /api/orders/create for submitting new orders and GET /api/orders for retrieving user order history. Specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, required headers (Authorization with Bearer JWT), request body schema for order creation (items array with id, quantity, customizations), and response formats (order confirmation object, order history array). Include validation rules (non-empty cart, valid item IDs), success (201, 200) and error status codes (400, 401, 404), and example cURL commands. Detail the order data structure (orderId, items, total, timestamp, status) and security considerations (JWT validation, order ownership checks). Provide guidance on error handling for invalid carts and rate-limited requests.

wiki_catalogs.name: Input Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the Input component used throughout MenuPRO-App-main. Detail its role as a controlled form input with Tailwind styling and Radix-based accessibility. Document supported props such as type, placeholder, value, onChange, disabled, and error states. Include TypeScript interface and integration with the form.tsx component for validation. Provide real-world examples from email-verification-screen and otp-verification-screen. Explain accessibility features (labels, aria-invalid), keyboard navigation, and mobile responsiveness using use-mobile.ts. Cover styling customization, focus states, and error visualization. Address common issues like uncontrolled-to-controlled input warnings and provide solutions. Include performance tips such as debouncing input events and optimizing re-renders.

wiki_catalogs.name: QR Scanning
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the QR scanning functionality in the PWA frontend. Describe how QRScanScreen integrates with browser-based camera APIs to enable real-time QR code detection, its fallback mechanisms for unsupported devices, and the event-driven communication with PWAApp via onScanComplete. Document the use of third-party libraries for QR decoding, error handling for failed scans, and UX patterns such as scan animation and feedback. Provide code examples illustrating the camera stream management and security considerations for camera permission requests. Explain how scanned data is validated and used to route users to the appropriate restaurant context. Address mobile-specific optimizations and offline behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: OTP Verification Process
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the OTP verification process in the restaurant frontend. Explain how RestaurantOTPScreen displays a 6-digit input field using the InputOTP component from UI library and submits the code to /api/restaurant/verify-otp. Document the state update via handleOTPVerified that stores the JWT token in localStorage and transitions the screen to 'menu-upload'. Include implementation details on countdown timers for resend functionality, error states for invalid OTPs, and navigation controls to return to onboarding. Use concrete examples from the renderScreen switch case in RestaurantApp. Address security considerations around token storage, rate limiting implications, and accessibility compliance for screen readers during code entry.

wiki_catalogs.name: Parse Menu API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for POST /api/restaurant/parse-menu. Document the HTTP POST method, endpoint URL, and required headers including Authorization with JWT and 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data'. Detail the request body with file upload (PDF or image up to 5MB), supporting formats: PDF, JPG, PNG. Explain the backend processing flow: file validation, extraction using pdf-parse for PDFs or Tesseract.js OCR for images, and structured JSON output of menu items with name, price, category, and description. Specify response schema: 200 OK with parsed menu array, 400 for invalid file type/size, 401 for unauthorized, 415 for unsupported media type, and 500 for processing failures. Include example cURL command with file upload. Discuss accuracy considerations for OCR, recommended image quality, and fallback strategies. Address security: file type validation, virus scanning (if implemented), and JWT authentication. Provide performance tips for handling large files and optimizing OCR processing time.

wiki_catalogs.name: Customer Verify OTP
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the POST /api/auth/verify-otp endpoint used to authenticate customers after OTP submission. Document the HTTP POST method, Content-Type header, and request body schema containing 'email' and 'otp' fields. Describe the server-side validation logic: checking OTP existence, expiration (5-minute TTL), and correctness. On success, generate a JWT token using jsonwebtoken with user role and expiration, return it in a secure, HTTP-only cookie or response body. Define response formats: 200 with success message and token, 400 for malformed input, 401 for invalid or expired OTP, 404 if no OTP found. Include security practices: constant-time comparison, protection against brute-force attacks, XSS mitigation via secure cookies. Provide example cURL and fetch usage, and explain integration with otp-verification-screen.tsx and subsequent navigation to menu-screen.tsx upon successful authentication.

wiki_catalogs.name: OTP Verification
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the OTP verification process in the PWA frontend. Explain how OTPVerificationScreen manages a 6-digit code input with individual input fields, auto-focus behavior between digits, and paste handling for clipboard content. Document the use of React hooks including useState for OTP, error, success, timeLeft, and canResend states, and useEffect for the 10-minute countdown timer that enables the resend option upon expiration. Detail the integration with /api/auth/verify-otp via mock validation (accepting '123456') and how the resulting authToken is passed up to PWAApp via onVerificationSuccess to transition to the menu screen. Include code examples for keyboard navigation (Backspace support), input masking, and token storage in localStorage under 'authToken'. Address security practices such as code expiration enforcement, rate limiting implications, and secure token handling. Discuss UI/UX aspects like the formatted countdown display, visual feedback for errors, and demo mode indicators.

wiki_catalogs.name: Directory Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the project's directory architecture. Break down the src/ directory into app/, components/, guidelines/, and styles/, explaining the purpose of each. Detail the Next.js App Router structure under src/app with page.tsx as the landing entry and API routes organized by domain (auth, orders, restaurant). Describe the components/ organization: pwa/ for customer-facing screens, restaurant/ for admin interfaces, and ui/ for reusable Radix-based components. Explain the role of __tests__ in validating user flows and integration. Highlight the separation between frontend (PWA) and backend (API routes) and how they interact. Include file naming conventions, routing mechanics, and asset handling. Provide a navigable map for developers to locate key functionality quickly.

wiki_catalogs.name: Menu Processing Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the menu processing backend service in MenuPRO-App-main. Detail the /api/restaurant/parse-menu endpoint that handles PDF and image-based menu uploads. Explain the integration with pdf-parse for document extraction and Tesseract.js for OCR processing of image menus. Document the file validation, MIME type checking, and buffer handling implementation. Describe the data transformation pipeline from raw text to structured menu items, including parsing logic and error recovery mechanisms. Include examples of input/output formats and edge cases like poorly scanned images or complex menu layouts. Address performance considerations for large files, timeout handling, and resource usage optimization. Provide guidance on extending the parser for new menu formats.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Component Library
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the UI component library built on Radix UI primitives and styled with Tailwind CSS. Detail each component's purpose, props interface, and usage patterns across both PWA and restaurant interfaces. Explain how components like Button, Input, Dialog, and Sheet ensure accessibility, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support. Document the use of utility functions like utils.ts and use-mobile.ts for responsive behavior. Provide code examples showing integration in forms (e.g., email verification) and modals (e.g., order confirmation). Address theming consistency, customization options via Tailwind classes, and performance considerations for rendering large lists (e.g., menu items). Include guidance on extending components while maintaining design system integrity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Email Verification Screen
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the email-verification-screen component responsible for collecting the user's email and initiating authentication. Explain its role in the identity verification pipeline, including form validation, submission handling, and API interaction with POST /api/auth/send-verification. Include code examples showing how input is captured, validated, and how loading/error states are managed. Document integration with the global PWAApp state and transition logic upon successful email submission. Address common issues like invalid email formats, network errors, or rate limiting. Provide best practices for error messaging and accessibility compliance for form inputs.

wiki_catalogs.name: Menu Upload and Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the menu upload functionality, covering both UI and backend processing. Explain how menu-upload-screen enables restaurants to upload PDF or image files of their menus, with support for drag-and-drop and file selection. Document client-side validation, file type restrictions, and progress feedback. Detail integration with the /api/restaurant/parse-menu API that uses pdf-parse and Tesseract.js for OCR-based extraction. Cover parsing logic, structured output transformation into MenuItem objects, and error handling for unreadable files. Include examples of expected input formats, parsing accuracy considerations, and fallback strategies. Address performance implications of large file processing and recommendations for optimal menu formatting.

wiki_catalogs.name: Menu Processing Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Menu Processing Service that extracts structured menu items from PDF documents or images using pdf-parse and Tesseract.js OCR. Explain the text preprocessing pipeline, price detection regex patterns, category inference logic, and confidence scoring algorithm. Document the ParsedMenuItem interface and how descriptions are inferred from adjacent lines. Include a breakdown of the parseMenuItems function logic, including duplicate removal and sorting by confidence. Provide usage examples from menu-upload-screen.tsx showing file input handling and API integration. Address accuracy limitations, recommended menu formatting, and suggestions for improving OCR results.

wiki_catalogs.name: Order Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Order entity that represents customer transactions in MenuPRO-App-main. Define all fields: id, email/customerEmail, items (array of item details), total, status (with allowed enum: pending, confirmed, preparing, ready, served), createdAt, estimatedTime, and optional tableNumber. Document discrepancies between API representation (email) and dashboard usage (customerEmail). Explain the OrderItem structure within the items array, including name, quantity, and price denormalization for historical accuracy. Detail status transition logic and business rules governing order lifecycle. Include sample JSON payloads for API requests and dashboard rendering. Describe how orders are created from CartItem data, persisted via API, and retrieved for restaurant management. Cover validation requirements and error handling during order creation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Restaurant API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Restaurant API in MenuPRO-App-main. Document POST /api/restaurant/generate-qr for generating table-specific QR codes and POST /api/restaurant/parse-menu for digitizing menus from PDF or image uploads. For each endpoint, detail HTTP method, URL, request headers, and body schema (table number for QR, file upload for menu parsing). Specify response formats (QR code image/data URL, parsed menu JSON structure), status codes (200, 400, 401, 500), and example cURL commands. Explain the OCR process using Tesseract.js for image-based menus and pdf-parse for PDFs, including supported formats and file size limits (5MB). Include security practices (file type validation, JWT authentication) and performance tips for handling large menu files.

wiki_catalogs.name: Card Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the Card component, a foundational UI container used for grouping related content in MenuPRO-App-main. Describe its structure with header, content, and footer slots, and styling via Tailwind classes. Document props (className, elevation, border), accessibility semantics, and responsive behavior across devices. Provide usage examples from menu-screen and restaurant-dashboard where cards display menu items and analytics. Explain composition patterns with Button, ImageWithFallback, and Badge components. Include guidance on customizing shadows, padding, and hover effects. Address performance by minimizing layout shifts and optimizing for PWA rendering. Demonstrate accessibility best practices such as proper heading hierarchy and focus management within interactive cards.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the authentication flow in the PWA frontend. Explain the two-step verification process starting with EmailVerificationScreen capturing user email and triggering API calls to /api/auth/send-verification, followed by OTPVerificationScreen handling code input and validation against /api/auth/verify-otp. Document the state management of userEmail and authToken within PWAApp, storage of JWT tokens in localStorage, and error handling for invalid or expired codes. Include code examples showing form validation, API integration using fetch, and loading states. Address security practices such as token expiration, XSS protection, and rate limiting considerations. Discuss UI/UX elements like resend timer, input masking, and success transitions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Menu Upload Mechanism
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the menu upload mechanism in MenuPRO-App-main. Explain how MenuUploadScreen accepts PDF or image files and sends them to the /api/restaurant/parse-menu API endpoint for processing using Tesseract.js OCR and pdf-parse. Document the state management of parsed MenuItem[] objects through handleMenuUploaded and transition to 'table-qr' screen. Detail file type validation, drag-and-drop interface behavior, loading states during parsing, and fallback options for manual entry. Include code examples showing the fetch request structure, response handling, and error recovery for corrupted files. Address performance considerations for large menus, accuracy limitations of OCR, and integration with the global restaurantData context.

wiki_catalogs.name: Restaurant Send Verification
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the POST /api/restaurant/send-verification endpoint used during restaurant onboarding. Specify the HTTP POST method, required Content-Type header, and JSON request body with 'email' field. Document the backend implementation: OTP generation, storage with 5-minute TTL, and transmission via configured SMTP service. Detail response codes: 200 for successful email dispatch, 400 for invalid email format, 429 for rate limiting (maximum 3 requests per email per 15 minutes). Highlight differences from customer flow: separate OTP storage namespace, potential use of environment-specific email templates. Include security aspects: input sanitization, transport security, and logging without sensitive data. Provide example cURL command and frontend integration example with restaurant-onboarding-screen.tsx. Explain how this step precedes OTP verification and menu upload access.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the frontend architecture of MenuPRO-App-main. Describe the component-based design using React with container-pattern components (PWAApp, RestaurantApp) managing state and orchestrating navigation between screens. Explain the unidirectional data flow from parent containers to presentational components like menu-screen.tsx and cart-screen.tsx. Document the use of React hooks (useState, useEffect) for state management without external libraries. Detail the UI component library in src/components/ui built on Radix UI primitives with consistent styling via Tailwind. Cover responsive design considerations, accessibility implementation, and PWA capabilities. Include diagrams showing component hierarchy, state propagation, and event handling. Address performance optimization through lazy loading and memoization where applicable.

wiki_catalogs.name: QR Code Generation System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the QR code generation backend in MenuPRO-App-main. Explain the implementation of the /api/restaurant/generate-qr endpoint using the qrcode library. Document the request parameters including table ID, restaurant ID, and customization options. Describe the SVG generation process, size configuration, and error correction levels. Include details on response formatting and browser compatibility considerations. Provide examples of integration with the restaurant dashboard and table management system. Address caching strategies for generated QR codes, rate limiting to prevent abuse, and security aspects like URL validation and XSS protection. Discuss potential enhancements such as dynamic QR updates and analytics tracking.

wiki_catalogs.name: Navigation and Routing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for navigation and routing mechanisms in MenuPRO-App-main. Explain how client-side routing is managed through state-driven navigation within PWAApp and RestaurantApp instead of traditional route-based navigation. Document the screen state pattern using React context or props to control which component is rendered (e.g., switching between qr-scan-screen and menu-screen). Contrast this with server-side routing in Next.js App Router used for landing page (/) and API endpoints. Describe the role of page.tsx as the entry point that initializes the application and renders either customer or restaurant interface based on context. Include examples of navigation triggers (e.g., after OTP verification) and conditional rendering logic. Address deep linking limitations and potential enhancements using URL hash or query parameters for screen restoration.

wiki_catalogs.name: OTP Verification Screen
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the otp-verification-screen component that handles one-time password validation. Explain its function in confirming user identity after email verification, including UI for OTP input fields and submission logic. Document integration with the input-otp component from the UI library and state synchronization with the PWAApp container. Include code examples showing how the OTP is sent to POST /api/auth/verify-otp and how success/failure responses are handled. Address edge cases such as expired OTPs, incorrect codes, and retry limits. Provide UX recommendations for countdown timers, resend functionality, and error recovery.

wiki_catalogs.name: Table QR Code Generation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the table QR code generation system. Explain how table-qr-screen allows restaurant owners to generate scannable QR codes for individual tables that link to their digital menu. Document integration with the /api/restaurant/generate-qr API, dynamic URL construction, and QR code rendering using the qrcode library. Cover customization options such as table numbering, download functionality, and print-ready formatting. Include guidance on physical placement, scanning reliability, and linking to the correct menu version. Address security aspects like URL tokenization, access control, and prevention of unauthorized menu access through QR codes.

wiki_catalogs.name: QR Code Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the QR Code Service that generates scannable QR codes for restaurant tables. Explain the API endpoint that accepts restaurantId and tableNumber to generate unique URLs for the ordering flow. Document the use of the qrcode library for SVG generation and how dynamic routing in Next.js enables direct access to specific tables. Include code examples from table-qr-screen.tsx demonstrating the generateQRCode function and its error handling. Describe the integration with the customer PWA flow, where scanning the QR code directs users to the correct menu. Address scalability considerations for high-volume QR generation and caching strategies for improved performance.

wiki_catalogs.name: RestaurantData Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the RestaurantData entity that captures restaurant profile information during onboarding and management in MenuPRO-App-main. Define all fields: name, email, phone, address, city, state, zipCode, cuisine, description, and operatingHours (open/close times). Document the TypeScript interface structure and usage context in both onboarding and dashboard components. Explain validation rules such as required fields, phone/email formatting, and operating hour constraints. Include sample payloads for form submission and profile display. Describe how RestaurantData is collected during onboarding, stored temporarily before verification, and potentially persisted after activation. Address data consistency between onboarding-screen and restaurant-app components, and explain how this model integrates with authentication and QR generation services.

wiki_catalogs.name: Form Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the Form component as a high-level abstraction for building accessible and validated forms in MenuPRO-App-main. Explain its architecture using React Hook Form and Zod validation schema integration. Detail components like FormField, FormItem, FormLabel, FormControl, and FormMessage. Provide examples from onboarding-screen and restaurant-onboarding-screen showing email and OTP workflows. Include TypeScript interfaces for form schemas, default values, and error handling. Explain accessibility features (aria-describedby, live regions), keyboard navigation, and screen reader support. Cover advanced usage like dynamic field arrays and conditional rendering. Address common issues such as validation race conditions and provide debugging strategies. Include performance optimization tips like memoizing form contexts and lazy-loading complex validators.

wiki_catalogs.name: Menu Browsing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the menu browsing experience in the PWA frontend. Describe how MenuScreen renders a scrollable grid of menu items with images, prices, and categories, and how it communicates item selection to PWAApp via onSelectItem. Explain the implementation of ItemDetailScreen for displaying comprehensive item information, customization options, and add-to-cart functionality. Document the data flow of MenuItem objects, conditional rendering of dietary tags, and responsive layout for various screen sizes. Include code examples demonstrating prop drilling from PWAApp, state management of selectedItem, and event handling for navigation. Address performance optimizations like virtualized rendering for large menus and image lazy loading.

wiki_catalogs.name: Table QR Code Generation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the table QR code generation feature. Explain how TableQRScreen calls the /api/restaurant/generate-qr API with restaurantId and table number to generate scannable QR codes for customer ordering. Document the onComplete callback that advances to the 'dashboard' screen and integrates with the global state. Describe the UI layout for batch printing, download options in PNG/SVG formats, and dynamic URL composition for deep linking to the menu. Use examples from the actual component props and API route interaction. Address scalability for multi-table setups, caching strategies for generated QRs, and customization options for branding and size.

wiki_catalogs.name: Restaurant Verify OTP
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the POST /api/restaurant/verify-otp endpoint that authenticates restaurant owners during onboarding. Document the HTTP POST method, request headers, and JSON payload containing 'email' and 'otp'. Describe server-side verification: lookup of stored OTP, validation of expiration (5-minute window), and correct value check. On success, generate a JWT token with restaurant role and attach it to the response via secure, HTTP-only cookie. Define response schema: 200 with success flag, 400 for invalid input, 401 for incorrect or expired OTP, 404 if no pending verification. Emphasize security measures: secure token generation with jsonwebtoken, protection against replay attacks, and secure cookie attributes (Secure, HttpOnly, SameSite). Provide usage examples in JavaScript and explain integration with restaurant-otp-screen.tsx and subsequent redirection to menu-upload-screen.tsx upon successful verification.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the backend architecture of MenuPRO-App-main. Describe the server-side logic implemented through Next.js API routes under src/app/api, organized by domain: auth, orders, and restaurant. Explain the RESTful design of endpoints using POST and GET methods with JSON payloads. Detail the authentication flow using JWT tokens, email verification, and OTP validation. Cover the order creation process, menu parsing via PDF or OCR (Tesseract.js), and QR code generation. Document middleware usage, error handling patterns, and request validation. Include data flow diagrams from API invocation to response, highlighting integration with external libraries. Address security practices such as input sanitization, rate limiting considerations, and token expiration policies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Menu Screen
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the menu-screen component that displays available food and drink items. Explain its role in rendering categorized menu items, handling search/filter interactions, and enabling navigation to item details. Document data fetching patterns, integration with the PWAApp state, and dynamic rendering of menu sections. Include code examples showing how menu data is structured and passed to child components like menu-grid. Describe behavior for empty menus or loading states. Address performance optimizations such as virtualized rendering and image fallbacks via ImageWithFallback. Provide UX guidance for accessibility, touch targets, and responsive design.

wiki_catalogs.name: Restaurant Dashboard
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the restaurant dashboard, the central hub for post-onboarding operations. Explain how restaurant-dashboard provides real-time order monitoring, menu status management, and business insights. Document UI components for viewing active orders, updating item availability, and tracking customer activity. Cover integration with order data from the backend, state synchronization, and notification systems for new orders. Include layout structure, responsive design considerations, and key performance indicators displayed. Address user experience for managing high-volume order periods and provide best practices for maintaining menu accuracy and responding to customer requests efficiently.

wiki_catalogs.name: Toast (Sonner) Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the Sonner-based toast notification system in MenuPRO-App-main. Explain its role in providing user feedback for actions like order submission, authentication success, or errors. Document API methods (toast.success, toast.error, toast.loading), props (duration, position, dismissible), and theming via CSS variables. Provide usage examples from cart-screen and payment-success-screen. Explain integration with React context for global state and handling concurrent toasts. Include accessibility considerations such as ARIA live regions, pause-on-hover, and keyboard dismissal. Address customization options like icons, actions within toasts, and dark mode support. Cover performance aspects like unmounting strategy, memory leaks, and throttling frequent notifications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Cart Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the cart management system in the PWA frontend. Detail how CartScreen displays the current cart items with editable quantities, selected options, and calculated totals, and how it interfaces with PWAApp's global cart state via onUpdateItem and onCheckout callbacks. Explain the implementation of updateCartItem for modifying quantities and options, including deep comparison of selectedOptions using JSON.stringify. Document the business logic for handling duplicate items with identical options, filtering out zero-quantity items, and maintaining cart integrity. Include code examples showing state mutation patterns, memoization of total calculations, and smooth UI transitions during updates. Address accessibility of cart controls and mobile-specific interaction patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Restaurant Dashboard UI
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Restaurant Dashboard UI in MenuPRO-App-main. Explain how RestaurantDashboard provides a centralized interface for viewing active orders, managing menu items, and accessing QR settings. Document the data display patterns using Radix UI tables and charts, logout functionality via handleLogout, and state synchronization with restaurantData and menuItems from RestaurantApp. Include layout structure for desktop-first design, responsive breakpoints, and navigation shortcuts to previous setup steps. Provide examples of how order updates are expected to be integrated (even if not fully implemented), and describe placeholder areas for future analytics. Address accessibility features like keyboard navigation and ARIA labels used in the dashboard components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Customer Ordering Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the customer ordering flow, covering the complete journey from landing to order confirmation. Explain each screen's purpose: onboarding-screen for initial access, qr-scan-screen for table identification, email and OTP verification for authentication, menu-screen for browsing items, cart-screen for managing selections, and order-confirmation-screen for finalizing. Document state transitions, navigation logic, and error handling during the flow. Include real code examples showing how user input is captured, validated, and passed between screens. Address edge cases like expired OTPs or empty menus. Provide UX guidelines for smooth interaction and performance tips for fast rendering on mobile devices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Cart Screen
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the cart-screen component that manages the customer's selected items. Explain its function in displaying cart items, calculating totals, and enabling quantity adjustments or removals. Document state management within PWAApp, including how addItem and removeItem actions are processed. Include code examples showing cart persistence across sessions using localStorage and integration with the checkout flow. Describe validation logic before proceeding to order confirmation. Address edge cases such as out-of-stock items or price changes. Provide performance tips for re-rendering efficiency and accessibility for screen readers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Other UI Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Provide an overview of additional UI components in the MenuPRO-App-main component library. For each componentAccordion, AlertDialog, Alert, Avatar, Badge, Checkbox, Dialog, DropdownMenu, Select, Tabs, and Tooltipdocument its purpose, key props, and usage context within the application. Highlight examples such as DropdownMenu in restaurant-dashboard for navigation, Tabs in menu-upload-screen for file type selection, and AlertDialog for confirmation actions. Explain shared patterns like portal rendering, controlled/uncontrolled states, and accessibility compliance via Radix UI. Include guidance on when to use each component and how they integrate with Tailwind styling and global themes. Address performance implications of heavy components like Dialog (lazy loading) and bundle splitting strategies. Provide cross-component composition examples such as Badge inside Avatar for status indicators.

wiki_catalogs.name: Order Confirmation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the order confirmation screen in the PWA frontend. Explain how OrderConfirmationScreen displays post-purchase information including order number, estimated preparation time, and success messaging, and how it receives orderNumber from PWAApp after successful order creation. Document the navigation options for starting a new order (which clears the cart) or returning to the landing page, including the use of window.location.reload() for full context reset. Include code examples showing the integration with the order creation lifecycle, display of dynamic timing information, and user engagement elements like success animations. Address localization considerations, printing support, and analytics tracking opportunities.

wiki_catalogs.name: Restaurant Management Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the restaurant management flow, detailing the onboarding, verification, menu upload, QR setup, and dashboard experience. Explain how restaurant-onboarding-screen collects business information, restaurant-otp-screen handles authentication, menu-upload-screen processes PDF/image files using parse-menu API, table-qr-screen generates scannable codes, and restaurant-dashboard provides order monitoring. Document form validation, file handling, and state persistence across steps. Include integration with backend APIs and error recovery mechanisms. Provide best practices for restaurant owners and troubleshooting tips for common upload or verification failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Order Confirmation Screen
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the order-confirmation-screen component that finalizes the customer's order. Explain its role in summarizing selected items, displaying total cost, and submitting the order via POST /api/orders/create. Document the submission workflow, loading states, and success/error handling. Include code examples showing how cart data is transformed into an order payload and how responses are processed. Describe navigation to the payment-success-screen upon success. Address failure scenarios such as network errors or invalid cart states. Provide UX recommendations for confirmation messaging, loading indicators, and post-order actions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Services
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the core services powering MenuPRO-App-main. Detail the Authentication Service handling email verification and OTP validation using JWT, the Order Management Service processing customer orders and persistence, the Menu Processing Service extracting menu items from PDFs or images via pdf-parse and Tesseract.js OCR, and the QR Code Service generating unique table identifiers. Explain service boundaries, input/output contracts, error codes, and retry mechanisms. Include sequence diagrams showing service interactions, performance benchmarks, and scalability considerations. Document how these services are consumed by both frontend and backend components and their role in maintaining system reliability.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Models
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the key entities in MenuPRO-App-main: MenuItem, CartItem, Order, and RestaurantData. Define each field's type, constraints, and business rules (e.g., price must be positive, order status transitions). Document relationships such as Order containing multiple CartItems, CartItem referencing MenuItem, and RestaurantData owning menu and QR configurations. Include sample JSON payloads and TypeScript interfaces. Explain data validation logic, serialization patterns, and how models are maintained across client and server. Provide schema evolution strategies and versioning considerations for future enhancements.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for all public endpoints in MenuPRO-App-main. For each endpoint, document HTTP method, URL, request headers (e.g., Content-Type, Authorization), request body schema, query parameters, and response format (success/error). Include authentication requirements (JWT, OTP), status codes, and example cURL commands. Cover POST /api/auth/send-verification, POST /api/auth/verify-otp, POST /api/orders/create, GET /api/orders, POST /api/restaurant/generate-qr, POST /api/restaurant/parse-menu, POST /api/restaurant/send-verification, and POST /api/restaurant/verify-otp. Provide error code tables, rate limiting policies, and versioning strategy. Include client implementation guidelines and security best practices for API consumers.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the UI component library in MenuPRO-App-main. Focus on reusable primitives from Radix UI wrapped with Tailwind styling and project-specific enhancements. Document each component's purpose, props (with types and defaults), events, and accessibility features. Include usage examples for button, input, card, form, and toast (sonner) components. Explain theming support, responsive behavior, and customization options via className or props. Provide guidance on component composition patterns, such as building forms with form.tsx and input.tsx. Address performance considerations like hydration and bundle size impact. Include live code snippets and visual examples for clarity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the authentication system used across both customer and restaurant flows. Explain the two-step verification process: email submission triggers OTP delivery via send-verification API, followed by OTP validation using verify-otp endpoint. Document JWT token generation, storage in localStorage, and expiration handling. Cover both customer and restaurant authentication paths, highlighting similarities and differences. Include security considerations like OTP expiration, brute-force protection, and secure token transmission. Provide flowcharts of the authentication sequence, error handling for invalid codes, and recovery options. Include code examples from both frontend screens and backend routes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Environment Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for environment configuration in MenuPRO-App-main. Detail the setup of environment variables for development, testing, and production, including SMTP credentials for email, JWT secrets, and API keys. Explain configuration files: next.config.js for routing and build settings, tailwind.config.ts for design tokens, tsconfig.json for TypeScript compilation, and jest.config.js for testing. Provide step-by-step instructions for setting up a local development environment, including required Node.js version and dependency installation. Include guidance on customizing configurations for deployment platforms like Vercel or AWS. Address common configuration errors and debugging techniques.

wiki_catalogs.name: Testing Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the testing strategy in MenuPRO-App-main. Describe the use of Jest as the test runner with React Testing Library for component tests and custom test utilities in test-utils.tsx. Cover unit testing of individual screens (e.g., cart-screen.test.tsx), integration testing of complete user flows (customer-flow.test.tsx), and restaurant-specific scenarios. Explain test setup, mocking strategies for API calls, and assertion patterns. Include coverage requirements, snapshot testing usage, and CI/CD integration. Provide examples of well-structured tests and common pitfalls to avoid. Address accessibility testing and performance regression detection.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create a step-by-step deployment guide for MenuPRO-App-main. Cover building the application using 'npm run build', environment variable configuration for production, and deployment options including Vercel, Netlify, or self-hosted servers. Explain static vs. server-side rendering implications, API route deployment, and domain configuration. Include SEO optimization based on SEO_STRATEGY.md, sitemap generation, and robots.txt configuration. Provide post-deployment verification steps, monitoring recommendations, and rollback procedures. Address common deployment errors and performance tuning tips for production environments.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: MenuPRO-App

## 1. Project Introduction

MenuPRO is a modern restaurant menu management and ordering system built with Next.js 14, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. The application provides a complete digital menu experience for both customers and restaurant owners, featuring a marketing landing page, progressive web app (PWA) functionality for customer ordering, and a restaurant management dashboard.

The core goals of MenuPRO are to streamline the restaurant ordering process through QR code scanning, provide an intuitive interface for menu browsing and customization, and offer restaurant owners tools to manage their digital menus and operations. The target audience includes restaurant patrons who want a seamless digital ordering experience and restaurant owners seeking an efficient way to manage their menus and customer orders.

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown

The application follows a modular architecture with clear separation of concerns. The main components are organized into distinct directories:

- **app**: Contains the Next.js App Router structure with API routes and page components
- **components**: Houses reusable UI components organized by functionality
- **src/app/api**: Implements server-side API endpoints for authentication, orders, and restaurant operations

### Design Patterns

The application employs several modern design patterns:

- **State Management**: Uses React hooks (useState) for client-side state management
- **Component Composition**: Implements a container-component pattern where container components (like PWAApp and RestaurantApp) manage state and pass data to presentational components
- **Type Safety**: Leverages TypeScript interfaces to ensure type safety across the application
- **API Design**: Follows RESTful principles for API endpoints with proper HTTP status codes

### System Relationships

```mermaid
flowchart TD
  A[Client] --> B[API Layer]
  B --> C[Authentication]
  B --> D[Order Management]
  B --> E[Restaurant Operations]
  C --> F[JWT Tokens]
  D --> G[In-memory Storage]
  E --> H[OCR/PDF Processing]
  I[UI Components] --> A
  J[State Management] --> A
```

### Data Flow

The application follows a unidirectional data flow pattern:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
  A[User Interaction] --> B[Component State]
  B --> C[Event Handlers]
  C --> D[API Calls]
  D --> E[Server Processing]
  E --> F[Data Storage]
  F --> G[Response]
  G --> H[State Update]
  H --> I[UI Re-render]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `src/app/page.tsx`: The main entry point that serves as a router between the landing page, customer PWA, and restaurant management interface
- `src/components/pwa-app.tsx`: Entry point for the customer-facing progressive web app
- `src/components/restaurant/restaurant-app.tsx`: Entry point for the restaurant management application

### Core Modules
- **Authentication Module**: Handles email verification and OTP-based authentication
- **Order Management**: Processes customer orders and maintains order state
- **Menu Processing**: Parses menu content from PDFs or physical documents using OCR
- **QR Code System**: Generates and processes QR codes for table ordering

### Configuration Approach
- `next.config.js`: Configures Next.js settings including image optimization and TypeScript handling
- `tailwind.config.ts`: Defines the Tailwind CSS configuration with custom color themes and spacing
- `package.json`: Manages project dependencies and scripts

### External Dependencies
- **Framework**: Next.js 14 with App Router
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with Radix UI components
- **State Management**: React hooks
- **API Services**: Nodemailer for email, jsonwebtoken for authentication, Tesseract.js for OCR, pdf-parse for PDF processing

### Integration Points
- **Email Service**: Gmail SMTP integration for sending verification codes
- **Authentication**: JWT-based token system for user verification
- **File Processing**: PDF parsing and OCR capabilities for menu digitization
- **QR Code Generation**: System for generating table-specific QR codes

### Component Relationships

```mermaid
graph LR
  A[Home Page] --> B[PWAApp]
  A --> C[RestaurantApp]
  B --> D[OnboardingScreen]
  B --> E[QRScanScreen]
  B --> F[EmailVerificationScreen]
  B --> G[OTPVerificationScreen]
  B --> H[MenuScreen]
  B --> I[CartScreen]
  B --> J[OrderConfirmationScreen]
  C --> K[RestaurantOnboardingScreen]
  C --> L[RestaurantOTPScreen]
  C --> M[MenuUploadScreen]
  C --> N[TableQRScreen]
  C --> O[RestaurantDashboard]
  P[API Routes] --> Q[Auth Verification]
  P --> R[Order Creation]
  P --> S[Menu Parsing]
  P --> T[QR Generation]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview

MenuPRO offers two primary experiences: a customer-facing ordering system and a restaurant management platform. The customer experience begins with QR code scanning, followed by email verification, menu browsing, item customization, cart management, and order placement. The restaurant experience includes onboarding, menu upload (via file upload or OCR), table QR code generation, and dashboard management.

### Implementation Highlights

The application implements several sophisticated features:

- **Progressive Web App**: The customer ordering flow is implemented as a PWA with a state machine that manages the navigation between different screens
- **Authentication Flow**: Uses a two-step verification process with email OTP verification secured by JWT tokens
- **Dynamic Menu Parsing**: Employs both PDF parsing and OCR technology to convert physical menus into digital formats
- **State Management**: Maintains complex state for shopping carts with item customization options

### Feature Architecture

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> LandingPage
    LandingPage --> CustomerFlow: Launch App
    LandingPage --> RestaurantFlow: Restaurant Signup
    CustomerFlow --> QRScan: Scan Table QR
    QRScan --> EmailVerification: Start Ordering
    EmailVerification --> OTPVerification: Email Sent
    OTPVerification --> MenuBrowsing: Verified
    MenuBrowsing --> ItemDetail: Select Item
    ItemDetail --> Cart: Add to Cart
    Cart --> OrderConfirmation: Checkout
    OrderConfirmation --> MenuBrowsing: New Order
    RestaurantFlow --> Onboarding: Register
    Onboarding --> OTPVerification: Email Sent
    OTPVerification --> MenuUpload: Verified
    MenuUpload --> TableQR: Upload Complete
    TableQR --> Dashboard: Setup Complete
    Dashboard --> MenuUpload: Update Menu
```

Sources:
- [README.md](README.md)
- [package.json](package.json)
- [page.tsx](src/app/page.tsx)
- [pwa-app.tsx](src/components/pwa-app.tsx)
- [restaurant-app.tsx](src/components/restaurant/restaurant-app.tsx)
- [next.config.js](next.config.js)
- [tailwind.config.ts](tailwind.config.ts)
- [send-verification/route.ts](src/app/api/auth/send-verification/route.ts)
- [verify-otp/route.ts](src/app/api/auth/verify-otp/route.ts)
- [create/route.ts](src/app/api/orders/create/route.ts)
- [parse-menu/route.ts](src/app/api/restaurant/parse-menu/route.ts)
</blog>
